creator: graham@raima.co.uk

text:
1) apr_set_option() is a private APR macro and can't be used from httpd

2) the Unix apr_socket_option_set() does handle APR_INCOMPLETE_READ so I guess
you're talking Win32 here

3) and Win32 doesn't care about APR_INCOMPLETE_READ, so is there actually a real
problem here?  Please describe the problems you're seeing.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
I am not seeing any problem, I was stepping through the code and saw
apr_set_socket_option() return APR_EINVAL, alarm bells rang, so I though best
submit a report in case the was a problem, I guess that means case closed on 
this, Thank you.
creator: graham@raima.co.uk
graham@raima.co.uk
text:
Or perhaps the win32 code should have a null case statement for the 
APR_INCOMPLETE_READ so the function does not return APR_EINVAL.
Not really a bug. Just a difference between win32 and unix behavoirs.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
